alert.note: Alert for Camden; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 6:59PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Camden and central Gloucester Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 658 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pitman, or 11 miles south of Gloucester City, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Deptford, Glassboro, Lindenwold, Bellmawr, Woodbury, Pitman, Clayton, Westville, Woodbury Heights, Chesilhurst, Sicklerville, Mullica Hill, Turnersville, Williamstown, Pine Hill, Runnemede, Stratford, Barrington, Clementon and Mount Ephraim. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 3. Interstate 76 in New Jersey near mile marker 0. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 25 and 28. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 36 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southern New Jersey.
